# Hyprland Dotfiles

Welcome to your Hyprland dotfiles repository! This repository contains configuration files and resources to set up and personalize your Hyprland environment on Linux. Whether you are a new user or an experienced Linux enthusiast, this guide will help you understand, use, and extend your Hyprland setup with ease.

---

## Table of Contents
- [About Hyprland](#about-hyprland)
- [Features](#features)
- [Repository Structure](#repository-structure)
- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
- [Usage](#usage)
- [Customization](#customization)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

---

## About Hyprland
[Hyprland](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland) is a dynamic tiling Wayland compositor that offers advanced window management, beautiful animations, and extensive customization. It is designed for power users who want a fast, modern, and highly configurable desktop experience.

## Features
- **Tiling and Floating Windows:** Flexible window management with support for both tiling and floating layouts.
- **Animations:** Smooth, customizable animations for transitions and window actions.
- **Wayland Native:** Built from the ground up for Wayland, ensuring modern graphics and security.
- **Highly Configurable:** Easily adjust keybindings, appearance, and behavior to fit your workflow.
- **Lightweight:** Minimal resource usage for maximum performance.

## Repository Structure
This repository is organized to keep your configuration files clean and maintainable. Typical structure (may vary based on your setup):

```
.
├── LICENSE           # License information
├── README.md         # This documentation
├── hypr/             # Main Hyprland configuration files
├── scripts/          # Helper scripts (if any)
├── wallpapers/       # Wallpapers and backgrounds
├── waybar/           # Waybar (status bar) configuration
├── rofi/             # Rofi (launcher) configuration
└── ...               # Other configs (e.g., kitty, alacritty, etc.)
```

> **Note:** If you do not see all these folders, you can create them as needed to organize your dotfiles.

## Getting Started
### Prerequisites
- A Linux distribution with [Hyprland](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Getting-Started/) installed.
- Basic familiarity with the Linux command line.

### Cloning the Repository
Clone this repository to your local machine:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/hyprland-dots.git
cd hyprland-dots
```

### Applying the Dotfiles
1. **Backup your existing configuration:**
   Before applying new dotfiles, back up your current Hyprland and related config directories.
2. **Copy or symlink the configs:**
   Place the configuration files in the appropriate locations, typically under `~/.config/`.
   For example:
   ```bash
   cp -r hypr ~/.config/
   cp -r waybar ~/.config/
   cp -r rofi ~/.config/
   # ...and so on
   ```
   Or use symlinks for easier updates:
   ```bash
   ln -s $(pwd)/hypr ~/.config/hypr
   ln -s $(pwd)/waybar ~/.config/waybar
   # ...and so on
   ```
3. **Restart Hyprland:**
   Log out and log back in, or restart Hyprland to apply the new configuration.

## Usage
- **Configuration:** Edit the files in the `hypr/`, `waybar/`, `rofi/`, etc., directories to customize your environment.
- **Themes:** Change wallpapers, color schemes, and bar styles to personalize your desktop.
- **Keybindings:** Adjust keybindings in the Hyprland config to match your workflow.

## Customization
- **Add your own scripts** to the `scripts/` directory for automation and workflow enhancements.
- **Integrate with other tools** like Rofi, Waybar, and notification daemons for a complete desktop experience.
- **Version control** your changes to keep your setup portable and reproducible.

## Contributing
Contributions are welcome! Feel free to open issues or submit pull requests to improve these dotfiles or add new features.

## License
This repository is licensed under the terms of the [MIT License](LICENSE).

---

**Enjoy your Hyprland experience!**

# Hyprland Dotfiles

Welcome to your Hyprland dotfiles repository! This repository contains detailed configuration files for Hyprland and related applications, organized under the `.config/` directory for easy management and portability.

---

## Table of Contents
- [About Hyprland](#about-hyprland)
- [Repository Structure](#repository-structure)
- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
- [Usage](#usage)
- [Customization](#customization)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

---

## About Hyprland
[Hyprland](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland) is a dynamic tiling Wayland compositor, offering advanced window management, beautiful animations, and extensive customization. It is designed for users who want a fast, modern, and highly configurable desktop experience.

## Repository Structure
All configuration files are stored in their respective directories under `.config/`, following the XDG Base Directory Specification. This makes it easy to manage, back up, and deploy your entire desktop environment.

Example structure:

```
.config/
├── hypr/        # Hyprland main configuration
├── waybar/      # Waybar (status bar) configuration
├── rofi/        # Rofi (launcher) configuration
├── kitty/       # Kitty terminal configuration
├── dunst/       # Dunst notification daemon config
└── ...          # Other application configs
```

> **Note:** Only the configuration directories you use will be present. Add or remove as needed for your setup.

## Getting Started
### Prerequisites
- A Linux distribution with [Hyprland](https://wiki.hyprland.org/Getting-Started/) installed.
- Familiarity with the Linux command line.

### Cloning the Repository
Clone this repository to your home directory:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/hyprland-dots.git
cd hyprland-dots
```

### Applying the Dotfiles
1. **Backup your existing configs:**
   ```bash
   cp -r ~/.config ~/.config.backup.$(date +%Y%m%d)
   ```
2. **Copy or symlink the configs:**
   ```bash
   cp -r .config/* ~/.config/
   # or, for easier updates:
   ln -s $(pwd)/.config/hypr ~/.config/hypr
   ln -s $(pwd)/.config/waybar ~/.config/waybar
   # ...repeat for each config you want to use
   ```
3. **Restart Hyprland:**
   Log out and log back in, or restart Hyprland to apply the new configuration.

## Usage
- **Edit configs:** Tweak files in `.config/{application}` to customize your environment.
- **Add new configs:** Place new application configs under `.config/` to version control them.
- **Keep it portable:** Manage all your desktop settings in one place for easy migration.

## Customization
- **Themes:** Change wallpapers, color schemes, and bar styles in their respective config files.
- **Keybindings:** Adjust keybindings in `.config/hypr/hyprland.conf` and other relevant configs.
- **Integrate tools:** Add configs for other tools (e.g., `dunst`, `mako`, `alacritty`) under `.config/` as needed.

## Contributing
Contributions are welcome! Open issues or submit pull requests to improve these dotfiles or add new features.

## License
This repository is licensed under the [MIT License](LICENSE).

---

**Enjoy your Hyprland experience!**

> **Note:** This repository is currently under development and may not be stable. I am actively pushing new configurations and features. Stable releases will be tagged and announced once they are ready. Use at your own discretion if you need a production-ready setup.
